alert.note: Alert for Candler; Evans; Inland Liberty; Long; Tattnall (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 19 at 11:23AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF EVANS, LIBERTY, CANDLER, LONG AND TATTNALL COUNTIES... At 1121 AM EDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Santa Claus to 9 miles southwest of Odum, and moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...strong winds 45 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar Indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Some locations in the path of these storms include... Hinesville, Reidsville, Metter, Glennville, Claxton, Fort Stewart, Walthourville, and Hagan. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so. You can also email your report to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.

area.areaDesc: Candler; Evans; Inland Liberty; Long; Tattnall
